title: Kriegspiel: the War-Game. [A novel.]
author: Groome, Francis Hindes
snippet: Now it would be a salmon, or a box of cigars, or a brace of grouse, a hare, or a couple of chickens; and on the morrow, perhaps, a big order of groceries, and three or four gorgeously-bound books (on remarkable subjects -1), or a fur-lined overcoat, or a gold scarf-pin, and so forth. They were always directed to " Mr. Leonard Keith, care of A. Wallace, 80 East Mayfield; " and at first Lionel always returned them to the shops from which they had been sent—no doubt to the contentment of the shopkeepers. Sagul must have discovered this, for presently they arrived with no indication of their source; and then it was difficult to know what to do with them, with such at least as were perishable.
